intro: Hypolytrum balakrishnanii, commonly known as the Balakrishnan's spike-rush, is a species of flowering plant in the family Restionaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal or inland areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
